p: A codebook was developed prior to data collection based on themes included in the guide. Once the team had reached saturation—the point where the same topics are emerging in each group [ 25, 26]–on the main themes being explored, the codebook was edited to reflect additional identified topics. Two researchers coded the discussions using Dedoose version 7.6.13, a web application for managing, analyzing, and presenting qualitative and mixed method research data [ 27]. Blind coding was used on every other transcription, and then compared, to ensure consistency in code application. Any differences were discussed and addressed before continuing with coding.
